transcript.sentence: In speech bubbles, white writing on black g q stories.
A town with lots of trees during the day.
A country road with trailers and cars on the sides.
An abandoned warehouse in an industrial area with pile of garbage in front.
A person sets up a makeshift tent at the side of the road.
In a tattoo parlor. Billy focus is closely as he uses a tattoo gun.
Text on screen beneath the ink, a film by side edson.
Main street of saints ville. Then inside red rose tattoo.
On a tv scenes from the news.
Billy, watch his scenes of riots with his tattoo covered, arms crossed.
A car plows into the crowd of protesters.
Slow motion of the car, hitting several people as the crowd flees in front of it.
Sign red rose tattoo.
Red rose tattoo artists. Jen sacred draws a mandela.
A young woman approaches a paper covered bed.
The young woman removes her socks to reveal a swastika on the Top of her left foot.
Then covers the swastika with her drawing.
She peels away the paper. And the mandela art covers the older tattoo.
Jen begins tracing the new lines with a tattoo gun on black ink.
She presses her lips together and shakes her head slightly.
Jen begins to fill in some of the design with t link.
Billy inks over a swastika on a man's chest.
Tractors and cars on the side of the road.
A bald man with a grey goatee.
Polaroid of a man with a baby and a woman with a toddler.
Handwritten note, John, I'm sorry, it had to end this way, but I can take no more living behind closed doors and the chill in this house.
I love you, John.
John walks across the grass.
In red rose tattoos. John approaches billy at the counter.
John removes his shirt. His back tattoo is a line drawing of a klansman in front of a flaming cross.
Billy wipes down john's back.
A picture on his phone of his dark skinned kid grinning.
Picture of John hugging his son.
Picture of a fair skinned little kid kissing John son on the cheek.
Billy takes a picture of john's back to show him the artwork he has drawn over the tattoo.
John lies on his stomach as billy traces the drawing with a tattoo gun using black ink.
Billy steps back from the bed.
His eyes fill with tears.
Family pictures.
Billy adds colors to john's new tattoo. It is a rampant eagle in white, blue and yellow.
Billy takes pictures of the tattoo and hands the phone to John.
Billy comes around the bed and hugs John and slaps him on the back.
Billy turns off the fluorescent open sign in the tattoo parlour window.
The foot tattoo was done.
He turns off the interior lights.
Credits beneath the ink directed by side dodson.
Featuring billie jo white.
Triumph pictures. Copyright 2018, all rights reserved.
Triumph pictures llc.

audio_descriptions.notes:
0:01 In speech bubbles, white writing on black: GQ Stories.

0:07 A town with a lot of trees during the day.

0:18 A country road with trailers and cars on the sides.

0:32 An abandoned warehouse and an industrial area with a pile of garbage in front.

0:46 A person sets up a makeshift tent on the side of the road.

1:02 In a tattoo parlour, Billy focuses closely as he uses a tattoo gun.

1:10 Text on screen: Beneath the Ink; a film by Cy Dodson.

1:19 Main street of Zanesville. Then, inside Red Rose Tattoo.

*1:30 Paige Natalie.*

1:58 On a TV, scenes from the news.

2:18 Billy watches scenes of riots with his tattoo-covered arms crossed.

2:27 A car plows into a crowd of protesters.

2:45 Slow motion of the car hitting several people as the crowd flees in front of it.

2:52 Sign: Red Rose Tattoo.

2:56 Red Rose Tattoo artist Jenn Siegfried draws a mandala.

3:07 A young woman approaches a paper-covered bed.

3:16 The young woman removes her socks to reveal a swastika on the top of her left foot.

3:29 Jenn covers the swastika with her drawing.

3:37 She peels away the paper and the mandala art covers the older tattoo.

3:50 Jenn begins tracing the new lines with a tattoo gun and black ink.

4:09 She presses her lips together and shakes her head slightly.

4:25 Jenn begins to fill in some of the design with teal ink.

5:08 Billy inks over a swastika on a man's chest.

5:24 Tractors and cars on the side of the road.

5:40 A bald man with a gray goatee. 

5:43 Polaroids of a man with a baby and a woman with a toddler.

6:16 Handwritten note: John; I'm sorry it had to end this way, but I can take no more living behind closed doors and the chill in this house. I love you John.

6:42 John walks across the grass.

6:54 In Red Rose Tattoos, John approaches Billy at the counter.

7:07 John removes his shirt. His back tattoo is a line drawing of a klansman in front of a flaming cross.

7:16 Billy wipes down John's back.

7:29 A picture on his phone of his dark skinned kid, grinning.

7:39 Picture of John hugging his son.

7:57 Picture of a fair skinned little kid kissing John's son on the cheek.

8:02 Billy takes a picture of John's back to show him the artwork he has drawn over the tattoo.

8:17 John lies on his stomach as Billy traces the drawing with a tattoo gun using black ink.

8:52 Billy steps back from the bed.

9:25 His eyes fill with tears.

9:56 Family pictures.

10:26 Billy adds colours to John's new tattoo. It is a rampant eagle in white, blue, and yellow.

10:33 Billy takes pictures of the tattoo and hands the phone to John.

11:06 Billy comes around the bed and hugs John and slaps him on the back.

11:24 The foot tattoo is done.

11:39 Billy turns off the fluorescent "open" sign in the tattoo parlour window.

11:46 He turns off the interior lights.

11:50 Credits: Beneath the Ink, directed by Cy Dodson.

11:53 Featuring Billy Joe White.

12:00 Triumph Pictures. Copyright 2018, all rights reserved, Triumph Pictures LLC.

result.title: The Tattoo Artist Who Covers Racist Tattoos | Beneath the Ink | GQ Stories
result.description:
In Zanesville, Ohio, tattoo artist Billy Joe White has offered to cover up swastikas, Nazi images, and other hate-filled ink for free. And he's been very busy.
Director Cy Dodson captures White's crusade to "erase the hate" and the relief of the repentant in this short film.

Still haven’t subscribed to GQ on YouTube? ►► http://bit.ly/2iij5wt

ABOUT GQ
For more than 50 years, GQ has been the premier men’s magazine, providing definitive coverage of style, culture, politics and more. In that tradition, GQ’s video channel covers every part of a man’s life, from entertainment and sports to fashion and grooming advice. So join celebrities from 2 Chainz, Stephen Curry and Channing Tatum to Amy Schumer, Kendall Jenner and Kate Upton for a look at the best in pop culture. Welcome to the modern man’s guide to style advice, dating tips, celebrity videos, music, sports and more.

https://www.youtube.com/user/GQVideos

The Tattoo Artist Who Covers Racist Tattoos | Beneath the Ink | GQ Stories
